intro: Cyrtochilum tanii, commonly known as the Tanii's orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, terrestrial growth habit. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pale yellow to greenish-white in color. Cyrtochilum tanii thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in montane forests. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
